00001 //_____________________________________________
00002 //
00003 // KHLASingleBoloSubRecord.cxx
00004 // KDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de> on 3/25/10.
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // The HLA class for Single Bolo Sub Records. It stores a significant amount
00011 // of information for each recorded bolometer event. It contains all of the 
00012 // calculated values from the ERA processing. See the descriptions below
00013 // of each of the parameters.
00014 //
00015 
00016 #include "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord.h"
00017 #include <iostream>
00018 #include <cstring>
00019 using namespace std;

00021 ClassImp(KHLASingleBoloSubRecord);

00023 KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::KHLASingleBoloSubRecord(void)
00024 {
00025         InitializeMembers();
00026         
00027 }
00028 
00029 KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::KHLASingleBoloSubRecord(const KHLASingleBoloSubRecord &aRec)
00030 : KSingleBoloSubRecord(aRec)
00031 {
00032         CopyLocalMembers(aRec);
00033         
00034 }
00035 
00036 KHLASingleBoloSubRecord& KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::operator=(const KHLASingleBoloSubRecord &aRec)
00037 {
00038         if(&aRec == this) return *this;
00039         
00040         this->KSingleBoloSubRecord::operator=(aRec);
00041         
00042         CopyLocalMembers(aRec);
00043         
00044         return *this;
00045 }
00046 
00047 void KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::CopyLocalMembers(const KHLASingleBoloSubRecord &aRec)
00048 {
00049         SetQvalue(aRec.GetQvalue());
00050         SetEnergyRecoil(aRec.GetEnergyRecoil());
00051         SetEnergyIon(aRec.GetEnergyIon());
00052         SetEnergyHeat(aRec.GetEnergyHeat());
00053         
00054         SetEventFlag(aRec.GetEventFlag());
00055         SetChi2Flag(aRec.GetChi2Flag());
00056         SetTriggerBit1(aRec.GetTriggerBit1());
00057         SetTriggerBit2(aRec.GetTriggerBit2());
00058         SetVoltageFlag(aRec.GetVoltageFlag());
00059         SetIonPulseTimeOffset(aRec.GetIonPulseTimeOffset());    
00060         
00061         SetFiducialVolume(aRec.GetFiducialVolume());
00062         
00063         aRec.GetIonFlags(fIonFlags, kSizeOfIonFlags);
00064         
00065         //fSambaRecord = aRec.fSambaRecord;  //don't copy TRef value.
00066         fSambaRecord = 0;
00067         
00068         for(Int_t i = 0; i < 2; i++){
00069                 SetEnergyCollectrode(i, aRec.GetEnergyCollectrode(i) );
00070                 SetEnergyVeto(i, aRec.GetEnergyVeto(i));
00071                 SetEnergyGuard(i, aRec.GetEnergyGuard(i) );
00072                 SetEnergyBaselineCollectrode(i, aRec.GetEnergyBaselineCollectrode(i));
00073                 SetEnergyBaselineVeto(i, aRec.GetEnergyBaselineVeto(i));
00074                 SetEnergyBaselineGuard(i, aRec.GetEnergyBaselineGuard(i) );
00075                 SetBaselineNoiseCollectrode(i, aRec.GetBaselineNoiseCollectrode(i));
00076                 SetBaselineNoiseVeto(i, aRec.GetBaselineNoiseVeto(i));
00077                 SetBaselineNoiseGuard(i, aRec.GetBaselineNoiseGuard(i));
00078         }
00079         
00080         SetEnergyIonFiducial(aRec.GetEnergyIonFiducial());
00081         SetEnergySumIonChannels(aRec.GetEnergySumIonChannels());
00082         SetBaselineIonFiducial(aRec.GetBaselineIonFiducial());
00083         SetEnergyBaselineHeat(aRec.GetEnergyBaselineHeat());
00084         SetBaselineNoiseHeat(aRec.GetBaselineNoiseHeat());
00085         
00086         fCuts = aRec.fCuts;
00087         fCuts.Compact();
00088 }

00091 KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::~KHLASingleBoloSubRecord(void)
00092 {
00093         //Does calling clear at destruction take too much computing time?
00094   Clear("C");
00095 }
00096 
00097 void KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::Clear(Option_t *opt)
00098 {
00099         //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00100   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00101   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00102   //inside of a TClonesArray
00103   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00104   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00105         KSingleBoloSubRecord::Clear(opt);
00106         
00107   //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00108         
00109   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00110   InitializeMembers();
00111         
00112 }
00113 
00114 void KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::InitializeMembers(void)
00115 {
00116   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00117   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00118         SetQvalue(-99.0);
00119         SetEnergyRecoil(-99.0);
00120         SetEnergyIon(-99.0);
00121         SetEnergyHeat(-99.0);
00122         
00123         SetEventFlag(-99);
00124         SetChi2Flag(-99);
00125         SetTriggerBit1(-99);
00126         SetTriggerBit2(-99);
00127         SetVoltageFlag(-99);
00128         SetIonPulseTimeOffset(-99);     
00129         
00130         SetFiducialVolume(-99.0);
00131         for(int i=0; i< kSizeOfIonFlags; i++){
00132                 SetIonFlagNumber(i,-99);
00133         }
00134         
00135         fSambaRecord = 0;
00136         
00137         for(Int_t i = 0; i < 2; i++){
00138                 SetEnergyCollectrode(i, -99.0 );
00139                 SetEnergyVeto(i, -99.0);
00140                 SetEnergyGuard(i, -99.0 );
00141                 SetEnergyBaselineCollectrode(i, -99.0);
00142                 SetEnergyBaselineVeto(i, -99.0);
00143                 SetEnergyBaselineGuard(i, -99.0 );
00144                 SetBaselineNoiseCollectrode(i, -99.0);
00145                 SetBaselineNoiseVeto(i, -99.0);
00146                 SetBaselineNoiseGuard(i, -99.0);
00147         }
00148         
00149         SetEnergyIonFiducial(-99.0);
00150         SetEnergySumIonChannels(-99.0);
00151         SetBaselineIonFiducial(-99.0);
00152         SetEnergyBaselineHeat(-99.0);
00153         SetBaselineNoiseHeat(-99.0);
00154         
00155         fCuts.Clear();  //resets all the values to zero and the array size to zero.
00156 }

00158 
00159 Int_t KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::GetIonFlagNumber(Int_t index) const
00160 {
00161         if(index < kSizeOfIonFlags && index >= 0){
00162                 return fIonFlags[index];
00163         }
00164         else
00165                 return -1;
00166 }
00167 
00168 Bool_t KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::GetIonFlags(Int_t* anArray, Int_t aSize) const
00169 {
00170         if(aSize == kSizeOfIonFlags){
00171                 memcpy(anArray, fIonFlags, sizeof(Int_t)*kSizeOfIonFlags);
00172                 return true;
00173         }
00174         else
00175                 return false;
00176 }
00177 
00178 Int_t KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::SetIonFlagNumber(Int_t index, Int_t aVal)
00179 {
00180         if(index < kSizeOfIonFlags && index >= 0){
00181                 fIonFlags[index] = aVal;
00182                 return fIonFlags[index];
00183         }
00184         else
00185                 return -1;
00186 }
00187 
00188 Bool_t KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::SetIonFlags(Int_t *anArray, Int_t aSize)
00189 {
00190         if(aSize == kSizeOfIonFlags){
00191                 memcpy(fIonFlags, anArray, sizeof(Int_t)*kSizeOfIonFlags);
00192                 return true;
00193         }
00194         else
00195                 return false;
00196 }

00198 Bool_t KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::IsSame(const KHLASingleBoloSubRecord &aRec, Bool_t bPrint) const
00199 {
00200         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00201         
00202         if(bPrint) cout.precision(16);
00203         
00204         
00205         if(!this->KSingleBoloSubRecord::IsSame(aRec,bPrint)){
00206                 bIsEqual = false;
00207                 if(!bPrint)
00208                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00209                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00210         }
00211         
00212         if(fQvalue != aRec.fQvalue){
00213                 bIsEqual = false;
00214                 if (bPrint) 
00215                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fQvalue Not Equal. lhs: " 
00216                         << fQvalue << " != rhs " << aRec.fQvalue << endl;               
00217                 else
00218                         return false;  
00219         }
00220         
00221         if(fEnergyRecoil != aRec.fEnergyRecoil){
00222                 bIsEqual = false;
00223                 if (bPrint) 
00224                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fEnergyRecoil Not Equal. lhs: " 
00225                         << fEnergyRecoil << " != rhs " << aRec.fEnergyRecoil << endl;   
00226                 else
00227                         return false;  
00228         }
00229         
00230         if(fEnergyIon != aRec.fEnergyIon){
00231                 bIsEqual = false;
00232                 if (bPrint) 
00233                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fEnergyIon Not Equal. lhs: " 
00234                         << fEnergyIon << " != rhs " << aRec.fEnergyIon << endl;         
00235                 else
00236                         return false;  
00237         }
00238         
00239         if(fEnergyHeat != aRec.fEnergyHeat){
00240                 bIsEqual = false;
00241                 if (bPrint) 
00242                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fEnergyHeat Not Equal. lhs: " 
00243                         << fEnergyHeat << " != rhs " << aRec.fEnergyHeat << endl;               
00244                 else
00245                         return false;  
00246         }
00247         
00248         for(Int_t i = 0; i < kSizeOfIonFlags; i++){
00249                 if(fIonFlags[i] != aRec.fIonFlags[i]){
00250                         bIsEqual = false;
00251                         if (bPrint) 
00252                                 cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fIonFlags["<<i<<"] Not Equal. lhs: " 
00253                                 << fIonFlags[i] << " != rhs " << aRec.fIonFlags[i] << endl;             
00254                         else
00255                                 return false;  
00256                 }
00257         }
00258         
00259         if(fTriggerBit1 != aRec.fTriggerBit1){
00260                 bIsEqual = false;
00261                 if (bPrint) 
00262                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fTriggerBit1 Not Equal. lhs: " 
00263                         << fTriggerBit1 << " != rhs " << aRec.fTriggerBit1 << endl;             
00264                 else
00265                         return false;  
00266         }
00267         
00268         if(fTriggerBit2 != aRec.fTriggerBit2){
00269                 bIsEqual = false;
00270                 if (bPrint) 
00271                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fTriggerBit2 Not Equal. lhs: " 
00272                         << fTriggerBit2 << " != rhs " << aRec.fTriggerBit2 << endl;

00274                         return false;  
00275         }

00280                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fVoltageFlag Not Equal. lhs: " 
00281                         << fVoltageFlag << " != rhs " << aRec.fVoltageFlag << endl;             
00282                 else
00283                         return false;

00300                 else

00302         }

00306                 bIsEqual = false;
00307                 if (bPrint) 
00308                         cout << "KHLASingleBoloSubRecord fSambaRecord Not Equal" << endl;               
00309                 else
00310                         return false;  
00311         }
00312          WE DON'T EXPECT THE TREFS TO BE EQUAL! in fact, we don't want it to be equal.
00313         */

00592 void KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::SetCuts(const TBits *mCuts)
00593 {
00594         fCuts = *mCuts;
00595         fCuts.Compact();
00596 }

00598 
00599 void KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::Compact(void)
00600 {
00601         //make the event class as small as possible. this calls 'Compact' for all member
00602         //variables that are KDS classes, member variables that can be compacted (such as TBits)
00603         //and base classes
00604         
00605         KSingleBoloSubRecord::Compact();
00606         
00607         fCuts.Compact();
00608 }
00609 
00610 Bool_t KHLASingleBoloSubRecord::TestCutsBitNumber(Int_t i) const 
00611 {
00612         //The ERA cuts file for each bolometer has been read and each cut has been packed into this
00613         //TBits object. The cuts correspond to the various cuts listed below.
00614         //cuts.CutChi2Col1 -- bit 0
00615         //cuts.CutChi2Col2 -- bit 1
00616         //cuts.CutChi2Vet1 -- bit 2
00617         //cuts.CutChi2Vet2 -- 3
00618         //cuts.CutChi2Gar1 -- 4
00619         //cuts.CutChi2Gar2 -- 5
00620         //cuts.CutChi2Heat -- 6
00621         //cuts.CutChi2     -- 7
00622         //cuts.CutCol1Base -- 8 //the baseline "too large" check
00623         //cuts.CutCol2Base -- 9
00624         //cuts.CutVet1Base -- 10
00625         //cuts.CutVet2Base -- 11
00626         //cuts.CutGar1Base -- 12
00627         //cuts.CutGar2Base -- 13
00628         //cuts.CutHeatBase -- 14
00629         //cuts.CutBases    -- 15
00630         //cuts.CutRun      -- 16
00631         
00632         
00633         return fCuts.TestBitNumber(i);
